"The body is born from marklessness.
It's like an illusion that produces forms and images.
The illusory mind and consciousness are originally nonexistent.
All sins and merits are empty, and there's nothing to abide in.'
The Longer Āgama Sutra says.

source_sentence: 人壽八萬歲時此佛出世。
translation: "When a person lives 80,000 years, this Buddha appears in the world.
He planted bharis.
His family name was Kulika.
His father was Pāṇḍu, and his mother was Pāṇḍu-vārti.
He lived in the city of Pāṇḍuvādhipati.
He sat under a palm tree and taught.

source_sentence: 三會度人三十四萬八千人。
translation: During those three rituals, he saved 348,000 people.
There are two priestesses.
One is Khe Sangsa.
The second is called Tiṣya.
He's attended by an attendant named Aśoka.
His son, Pūrṇa Maitrāyaniputra, was a great success.

source_sentence: 尸棄佛(莊嚴劫第九百九十九尊)偈曰。
translation: Śikhin Buddha (the 999th most honored of the Dhāraṇīs) spoke in verse.
"The initiation of good qualities is originally an illusion.
The creation of bad actions is also illusory.
Their bodies are like foam, and their minds are like the wind.
Illusory formations have no root and no true nature.
The Longer Āgama Sutra says.

source_sentence: 人壽七萬歲時此佛出世。
translation: "When a person lives 70,000 years, this Buddha appears in the world.
He planted bharis.
His family name is Kulika.
His father was a man of vision.
His mother was luminous and brilliant.
He stayed in the city of luminosity.
He sits under the Pūrṇa-puṇḍarīka tree and preaches.
He saved 250,000 people in three assemblies.
There are two prized possessions of a priest.
One is called abhidharma.
The second is called Bāvabhū.
He's an attendant who practices patience.
Their sons are countless.

source_sentence: 毘舍浮佛(莊嚴劫第一千尊)偈曰。
translation: The verse of Vaiśālībha Buddha (the thousandth most honored of the Dhāraṇīs) says.
"It's assumed that the four elements make up a body.
The mind is originally unarisen because the objects exist.
If the prior object were nonexistent, the mind wouldn't exist either.
Sins and blessings arise and cease like illusions.
The Longer Āgama Sutra says.

source_sentence: 人壽六萬歲時此佛出世。
translation: "When a person lives 60,000 years, this Buddha appears in the world.
He planted bharis.
His family name was Kulika.
His father was a good lamp.
His mother called him 'Preceptor'.
He lived in the metaphor-free city.
He sits under a palm tree and preaches.
He had saved 130,000 people in two assemblies.
There are two priests.
One is Fuyu.
The second is called Uttarakuru.
The attendant is tranquil.
His son, Sumeru, was marvelously enlightened.

source_sentence: 拘留孫佛(見在賢劫第一尊)偈曰。
translation: Kauśāmbī (seen as the first among the worthies of the eon) spoke in verse.
"Seeing the body as insubstantial is the Buddha's body.
'Understanding that the mind is illusory is the Buddha's illusion.'
'Understanding the innate emptiness of body and mind is the Buddha's illusion.'
What difference does it make between this person and the Buddha?
The Longer Āgama Sutra says.

source_sentence: 人壽四萬歲時此佛出世。
translation: 'When a person lives 40,000 years, this Buddha appears in the world.
He grew up as a Brāhmaṇa.
His family name was Kāśyapa.
His father revered virtue.
His mother was a good disciple.
He lived in the city of An and Peace.
He sits under the Śirīṣa tree and preaches.
At one meeting, he saved 40,000 people.
There are two spiritual powers.
One is a novice.
The second is Virūḍhaka.
He's attended by a consort, Sunetra.
The son is superior.

source_sentence: 拘那含牟尼佛(賢劫第二尊)偈曰。
translation: Kanakamuni Buddha (the second most honored of the good eons) said in a verse.
"A buddha who doesn't see a buddha knows he's a buddha.
If there really is, he knows there's no Buddha at all.
A wise person can know that the nature of sins is empty.
He's completely calm and has no fear of birth and death.
The Longer Āgama Sutra says.

source_sentence: 人壽三萬歲時此佛出世。
translation: "When a person lives 30,000 years, this Buddha appears in the world.
He's a Brahmin of the family.
His family name was Kāśyapa.
His father was a great virtuous man.
His mother was excellent.
He lived in the pure city.
He sits under the udumbara tree and teaches.
At one meeting, he saved 30,000 people.
There are two miraculous powers.
One is Upananda.
The second is Uttarakuru.
He's accompanied by an attendant, Anhe.
"My son, the teacher.

source_sentence: 迦葉佛(賢劫第三尊)偈曰。
translation: Kāśyapa Buddha (the third most honored of the good eons) spoke in verse.
"The nature of all sentient beings is pure.
From the beginning, there's no arising and nothing to cease.
That is, this body and mind are illusory creations.
Within illusory transformation, there's no guilt or merit.'
The Longer Āgama Sutra says.

source_sentence: 人壽二萬歲時此佛出世。
translation: "When a person lives 20,000 years, this Buddha appears in the world.
He grew up as a Brāhmaṇa.
His family name was Kāśyapa.
His father was a Brahmā virtuous man.
